Longer answer:

Several suggestions to relieve people from the annoyance of AFKs have been made over the years. Most haven't been accepted, the only ones who stick were direct penalties (automatic/instant ban, queue time increases) who benefitted no one.
Among the refused options, most were denied because of possible abuse, due to one simple thing: they gave bonuses, creating the question "should i leave?". The answer, for Riot, should just be "no fucking way".
The typical example is "if X people AFK for X minutes, the game should be invalid / others should be free to leave / leavers should take the whole LP loss instead of the team". Some similar "solution" got adopted by other MOBAs, and usually saw the rise of new form of tocix/abusive behaviour.
I don't know if you ever played bad in HoN.

Truth is, at the moment, rating is set in favor of non-leavers and against leavers. Applying your suggestion would reverse the effect.
Assume you do not leave games. Assume you have a leaver every, say, five games, to make it big.
Over a hundred games, you'll meet twenty leavers. Of these, 9 will be on your team, and 11 on the opposing team (unless you're the leaver). Assuming all games with a leaver are a loss, this nets you a total of two free wins, pushing your rating up. All the leavers, instead, got a lot of losses, which just means they lose more frequently than you (on a rate that depends on their leaver frequency).
Sure, it's a lot of assumptions, but it fits most cases, and exceptions get smoothed out over time.
And it only benefits non-leavers.
